conclusion: Determine if Car A is ahead or behind Car B at t = 10 seconds by analyzing distance traveled.
Distance traveled is found by calculating area under v-t graph up to t = 10 seconds.
Car A's velocity increases from 0 to 40 m/s linearly over 10 seconds.
Car A's graph forms a right triangle with base 10s and height 40 m/s.
Car B's velocity increases linearly from 0 to 20 m/s over 10 seconds.
Car B's graph forms a right triangle with base 10s and height 20 m/s.
Distance traveled by Car A = 200 meters; Car B = 100 meters.
At t = 10 seconds, Car A has traveled more distance than Car B.
Car A is ahead of Car B at t = 10 seconds.
